subject: https://spec.pistoiaalliance.org/idmp/ontology/EXT/Examples/AmlodipineExample/
both right and left: This ontology provides an example for some of the data related to the substance, amlodipine, to demonstrate substance and basis of strength representation.

subject: https://spec.pistoiaalliance.org/idmp/ontology/EXT/Examples/AmlodipineExample/AmlodipineMesylateMonohydrate
both right and left: mesylate salt of amlodipine, a long-acting calcium channel blocker

Amlodipine mesylate monohydrate is chemically described as 3,5-Pyridinedicarboxylic acid, 2-((2-aminoethoxy)methyl)-4-(2-chlorophenyl)-1,4-dihydro-6-methyl-, 3-ethyl 5-methyl ester, monomethanesulfonate, monohydrate.

subject: https://spec.pistoiaalliance.org/idmp/ontology/EXT/Examples/AmlodipineExample/PfizerInc
both right and left: American multinational pharmaceutical and biotechnology corporation headquartered on 42nd Street in Manhattan, New York City.

subject: https://spec.pistoiaalliance.org/idmp/ontology/EXT/Examples/AmlodipineExample/AmlodipineAsActiveMoiety
both right and left: amlodipine in the role of an active moiety

subject: https://spec.pistoiaalliance.org/idmp/ontology/EXT/Examples/AmlodipineExample/KentPharmaUKLtd
both right and left: pharmaceutical company headquartered at The Bower, 4 Roundwood Avenue, Stockley Park, Heathrow, UB11 1AF

subject: https://spec.pistoiaalliance.org/idmp/ontology/EXT/Examples/AmlodipineExample/Amlodipine
both right and left: It is a long-acting dihydropyridine calcium channel blocker effective in the treatment of angina pectoris and hypertension.
fully substituted dialkyl 1,4-dihydropyridine-3,5-dicarboxylate derivative, which is used for the treatment of hypertension, chronic stable angina and confirmed or suspected vasospastic angina

subject: https://spec.pistoiaalliance.org/idmp/ontology/EXT/Examples/AmlodipineExample/NorvascConstituency
both right and left: constituency of the pharmaceutical product that is a besylate salt of amlodipine

NORVASC (amlodipine besylate) Tablets are formulated as white tablets equivalent to 2.5, 5, and 10 mg of amlodipine for oral administration. In addition to the active ingredient, amlodipine besylate, each tablet contains the following inactive ingredients: microcrystalline cellulose, dibasic calcium phosphate anhydrous, sodium starch glycolate, and magnesium stearate.

subject: https://spec.pistoiaalliance.org/idmp/ontology/EXT/Examples/AmlodipineExample/AmlodipineBesylate
both right and left: Amlodipine besylate is chemically described as 3-Ethyl-5-methyl (±)-2-[(2-aminoethoxy)methyl]-4-(2-chlorophenyl)-1,4-dihydro-6-methyl-3,5-pyridinedicarboxylate, monobenzenesulphonate. Amlodipine besylate is a white crystalline powder with a molecular weight of 567.1. It is slightly soluble in water and sparingly soluble in ethanol.
besylate salt of amlodipine, a long-acting calcium channel blocker
